reviews.review_msg: Got a C but loved his class. Got a low mark because did not study enough. Take notes! he does not post them. Exam questions were not easy. Likes to connect theorists with their theories on exams. oh and very good looking which kind of makes you want to show up for class lol

He is a great professor! Very interested in what he teaches and tries to keep class entertaining for everyone! He normally doesn't post slides unless by special request, and that is fine, since writing notes keeps students engaged.

Do not take this class with him! Extremely boring lecturer, and super difficult to communicate with due to his way of answering questions. He has the worst communication skills ever. Mid-term marks were super low and he is not open to any suggestions.

if you want to drop your gpa then take this course. He'll bend the rules screw you over on the exam. Average was around 50% for mid term he had to bump it up or something. TAKE IT WITH SOMEBODY ELSE. I'm being real and not saying this to scare you. It's a fact! WORST PROF IN SFU BY FAR. His laugh is also very scarey

He's not a good prof at all. His exams are really tough. Average was so low he had to boost it by 10%. By far the most inconsiderate prof I've ever had. When you discuss your project with him, he doesn't tell you what he's looking for so basically your handing in the paper with no clue. I'm a 3.8 GPA student and I got a C+. BIGGEST GPA FLUNKER CLAS

Very unfair and harsh at marking papers for first year course,lectures boring from the book. The good things is that he brings guest speakers.If you want a "solider teacher" take him because he is very strict. I think students should have some say of lecture because we pay tuition, but he refuses to give power point lecture slides. Inconsiderate

Had Andrew a few semesters ago and he's a fantastic TA. Anyone who complains about him obviously just didn't try very hard in the class---it's not his fault how the prof asks him to grade things! It's true that he's ridiculously attractive, but aside from that, he's smart, helpful, and explains things well. He's going to make a fantastic prof.
AMAZING TA! I hope he TAs other courses in the future. Clear, fair but tough marker, and nice to look at, too.

He knows his material  and teaches well.  There is only so much a TA can do when there is no one that responds to conversation about topics in tutorial.  He does mark difficult but that is part of the job.  This is university not community college first come first in program. Rather will not comment on looks.

Does not mark hard, but rather unfairly. Not open to having marks disputed. Can't believe the prof let him mark the mid-term, presentations etc. among other things. Seems like he's just marking hard to prove something to the prof. about his "strictness." Let's hope he doesn't expand past his TA role and actually teach other classes.

Has no knowledge on basic computers and is only TAing this class because he is friends with the instructor. Due to his inexperience, he marked the midterm exams horribly. He should get a job that he is actually qualified for!
